or symptoms of infection, 
however the infection can be 
easily spread to other children 
and to adults who are caring for 
the child, such as parents and 
childcare providers.
If you get infected with CMV 
when you are pregnant you 
can pass the virus on to your 
unborn baby. This can result 
in complications for the baby 
which include low birthweight, 
stillbirth, childhood hearing 
loss, speech and language 
difficulties	and	occasionally	
seizures and brain damage.
